title: She's Gone: It’s a mother’s worst fear. An utterly cracking psychological thriller (The Detective Jo Boden Case Files Book 1)
features: When her teenage daughter disappears, Marcia fears the worst. She’ll do anything to find Phoebe, but her nightmare is just beginning…
Marcia Lennox seems to have the perfect life. A loving husband, Harry, a beautiful daughter, Phoebe, a successful career, and an expensive London home.
But in her third week at university, Phoebe vanishes without a trace.

As Detective Sergeant Jo Boden from the Major Investigations Team examines the mystery of Phoebe’s disappearance, she uncovers a complex web of deceit. Like most teenagers, Phoebe has secrets she kept from her parents. But is she caught in a deadly game of cat and mouse? And is it too late to save her?
In her desperation, Marcia knows she must risk everything to find Phoebe.

But her happy and comfortable life is a front. Estranged from her birth family, with a marriage on the rocks, Marcia must find the courage to leave her safe London bubble. She must journey back to the wilds of East Anglia and the desolate Norfolk Fens to confront her own dark past.
Can she face her demons to save her child? And will the truth destroy them?

‘She’s Gone’ is a heart-stopping thriller that explores the depths of a mother's love and the lengths she will go to, to protect her child. With a gripping plot, engaging characters, and unexpected twists and turns, this book will keep you guessing until the very end.
Readers love Susan Wilkins’ crime thrillers
‘Well plotted and unflinchingly told.’ Sunday Express
‘Murder, corruption and a crafted plot make for a fine read.’ The Sun
‘This stylish, clever crime story never lets up… Blazingly brilliant.’ Sunday Mirror
‘Dark and gripping from first page to last, this is Susan Wilkins at her nail-biting best.’ Jessie Keane
‘I was engaged from the very first chapter… Brilliant.’ Goodreads reviewer, ★★★★★
description: I'm Susan Wilkins, a television writer turned novelist, and I write crime thrillers that dig deep into human psychology.How do ordinary people end up on the wrong side of the law? That's what I'm always asking. The characters are central to all my stories. The protagonists tend to be female, but not always, and I specialise in female detectives.I grew up in Essex, studied Law, but spent twenty-five years writing television drama. I have over 130 broadcast credits to my name, including Casualty and Holby City, Heartbeat, Coronation Street and Eastenders, Footballers' Wives, Dangerfield and Down to Earth, and I created the pioneering BBC detective drama South of the Border. This was the best education anyone could have in how to craft a gripping, page turning story.I've just completed my tenth crime thriller. I've moved around a lot in my life, within the UK and abroad. But now I'm settled in Devon. I walk by the sea every day and drink too much coffee.If you'd like to find out more about my writing and keep in touch with my latest news, exclusive content and giveaways, visit susanwilkins.co.uk Follow me on Amazon to get news of new releases and special offers.You can also follow me on social media: facebook.com/susanwilkinsauthor twitter.com/susanwilkins32 instagram.com/susan_wilkins32
